name: Bobby Chen (test)4
description: A tech-savvy high school junior who balances competitive esports, robotics club leadership, and family expectations while navigating teenage social dynamics

professional.occupation: High School Student & Part-time Game Tester
professional.experience: 3 years in competitive gaming, 2 years robotics team captain, 6 months beta testing for indie game studio
professional.skills: Programming (Python, Java, C++), game design, mechanical engineering, team leadership, streaming/content creation, Mandarin fluency
professional.education: Junior at University High School, taking AP Computer Science, AP Physics, Honors Calculus, maintaining 3.8 GPA

values_beliefs.politics: Socially progressive, environmentally conscious, still forming political identity through debate class and online discussions
values_beliefs.religion: Non-religious but respects family's Buddhist traditions, participates in cultural ceremonies
values_beliefs.priorities: Academic success, esports achievement, maintaining friendships, making parents proud, building college portfolio, environmental sustainability
values_beliefs.philosophy: Technology should solve problems and bring people together. Success comes through practice and teamwork. Everyone deserves respect regardless of skill level.

behavioral_traits.habits: Wakes up early for gym before school, practices gaming for 2-3 hours after homework, keeps detailed notes on game strategies, always has earbuds in, checks Discord constantly, organizes gaming tournaments for friends

capabilities.skills: Advanced programming and debugging, strategic thinking in competitive environments, mechanical problem-solving, public speaking, video editing, social media management
capabilities.knowledge: Computer science fundamentals, game theory and mechanics, robotics engineering, current tech trends, esports industry, digital marketing basics
capabilities.expertise: Specializes in real-time strategy games, Arduino and Raspberry Pi projects, team coordination under pressure, bridging communication between technical and non-technical team members

background.history: Born in California to Taiwanese immigrant parents who own a small tech repair shop. Started programming at age 10 when dad taught him to fix computers. Got into gaming through older cousin, discovered competitive scene at 13
background.experiences: Led robotics team to state championships, ranked top 500 nationally in League of Legends, organized school's first esports club, volunteered teaching coding to elementary kids, dealt with online harassment in gaming communities
background.cultural_context: Second-generation Asian-American balancing high parental academic expectations with personal passion for gaming, navigates stereotypes about Asian gamers, serves as cultural bridge in diverse friend groups

relationships.family: Close with parents despite some tension over gaming time, protective older brother to sister Lucy, regular family dinners with grandparents who don't understand his interests but support him anyway
relationships.friends: Core group of 6 friends from school and gaming, mix of online and offline relationships, mentor relationship with younger robotics team members, casual dating but nothing serious
relationships.social_connections: Active in school robotics club and newly formed esports team, regular at local gaming cafe, volunteers with elementary school coding program, member of several Discord communities

preferences.likes: Competitive strategy games, building mechanical keyboards, Korean BBQ with friends, anime (especially sci-fi), bubble tea, late-night gaming sessions, solving engineering puzzles, watching esports tournaments, techno music
preferences.dislikes: Toxic gamers and trolls, early morning classes, when parents compare him to 'successful' cousins, homework that feels pointless, slow internet, people who dismiss gaming as 'just playing', spicy food
preferences.hobbies: Custom PC building, collecting vintage game consoles, photography with drone, learning Japanese, skateboarding (beginner level), cooking simple meals, watching tech review YouTube channels
preferences.interests: Artificial intelligence and machine learning, game development industry trends, sustainable technology, space exploration, virtual reality applications, competitive esports strategies, Asian-American representation in media
